ETYMOLOGY: From Old English trūht, from Late Latin tructa, from Ancient Greek τρώκτης (trṓktēs, 'gnawer, glutton'), from τρώγω (trṓgō, 'I gnaw').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A common, widely distributed freshwater fish of the salmon family (Salmonidae), highly prized for food and sport fishing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 鲑鱼科的一种常见的、分布广泛的淡水鱼，因其肉质和钓鱼运动而备受珍视。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We caught several beautiful rainbow trout in the mountain stream.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在山涧里钓到了几条漂亮的虹鳟鱼。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Informal, derogatory) An unpleasant, cantankerous, or difficult old woman.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (非正式，贬义) 指一个令人不快、脾气暴躁或难缠的老妇人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Don't mind what she says; she's just an old trout.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 别在意她说的，她就是个老巫婆。

REGISTER: General, with a specific informal/derogatory use.
